text:
You're very welcome! I'm always happy to help others experience a great game, and Ocarina of Time is a great game no matter what platform you play it on. But I do think that the 3DS Version is possibly the best one, for the reasons I stated in my earlier comment. 

Also, A Link Between Worlds looks great. I myself have played A Link To The Past, and this looks like it'll be about as good! Fingers crossed! :)

author: Alfonso ST

text:
I have the Zelda Edition 3DS; so if SupraDarky's response (if he responds) isn't enough, here's my take:

Yes, Ocarina of Time is a FANTASTIC game, even on the 3DS. The controls are very tight and responsive, about as good as the N64's (if not better). The graphics are beautiful, everything just looks STUNNING.

So yes, since you haven't played the 3D version, I can personally tell you that it's a great game, and certainly worth purchasing. :)
author: JuanitoShet

text:
I don't think that's the controls themselves; I think that's just you. I've never had a problem with them, which is contrary to your opinion, of course.

I also completed the game 100%, and I feel that even the Special Stages aren't challenging enough. But I did greatly enjoy the game, and I still go back to play it once in a while, or to beat my time in certain stages. :B
author: JuanitoShet

text: I wish I liked this game more, the big open parts always ended in  disappointment seeing as they go straight back into linear platforming.  Any parts you could explore got interrupted by the damn timer.
author: HyMyNameIsMatt

text: It's a good song but I wish they had different songs for more of the levels. It was the same in new super mario brothers >.>
author: Robin Glick

text: If I may ask, have you played OOT on the 3DS? What's your opinion of the game? Is it worth buying? Is the 3D any good? What about the controls? The N64 Controller was Perfect IMO for Zelda OOT
author: The Destati

text: If there's one thing I didn't like, it's the controls, which is very surprising for a franchise that always nails them. It takes too long for Mario to build up enough speed and momentrum to pull off long distance jumps, which resulted in a lot of failed and frustrating attempts. I learned to run around in a circle before﻿ going for a jump so I had good enough speed, but that really wasn't﻿ ideal.
author: SupraDarky

text: What a great and fun game this was. I went through all the stages with a constant smile on my face, then I realized there was another much harder half to the game with the Special worlds... At that point my smile sometimes had to give way to my game face, especially the very last bonus stage! There's a suprising amount of content and challenges if you want to 100% the game. Played the whole game with full 3D as well.
author: SupraDarky
